snippet.title: The Closer We Get
snippet.description:
Get the paperback & eBook here: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CHLC1XJ2
Get the audiobook here: https://pursuitofwonder.com/product/the-closer-we-get-audiobook

Book description: 
Adam has spent the last couple of years focusing on himself, trying to get his life and career in order. Now, entering his thirties, he’s painfully alone, struggling to meet and date anyone.

After a series of unusual encounters with a woman whom Adam feels an attraction to unlike anyone he has before, he begins to experience strange problems, and he finds himself in deeply unsettling situations. Adam must discover what it means to love and be loved, and what he's willing to endure and sacrifice to truly be with someone.

"The Closer We Get" combines a timeless exploration of the intricacies and struggles of relationships with the backdrop of an increasingly surreal and mind-bending near-future world.

In this video, we explore the life, work, and influence of 18th century German philosopher, Immanuel Kant. snippet.description:

It is a prevailing goal in life to be yourself. We want to be authentic and self-honest -- and we should. But when we think about this, we inevitably encounter the problem: who even are we? snippet.title: Is Infinity Real?
snippet.description:
Prints now available at: https://pursuitofwonder.com/store

Infinity is really big. It's infinite. But what does it mean when an infinity is proved to be bigger than another? How can something infinite be bigger than something else that is also infinite? This video attempts to explore a fairly introductory, laymen understanding of mathematic infinity, and how trying to wrap our brains around endlessness can be just as endless.

snippet.title: Why We Feel Lonely & Alienated - Charles Bukowski's "The Crunch"
snippet.description:
Charles Bukowski reads a version of his poem, "The Crunch." In which, he describes how the cruelties and corruptions of humankind lead us to all feel alone and alienated from one another. He implies that this is merely a feature of our nature and can not be avoided. That fundamentally we are all deeply flawed, confused, and self-interested, and consequently, many of us become cruel and detached from our fellow persons. However, Bukowski leaves us with a crumb of potential hope at the end of the poem. The notion that his brain still tells him there is hope, even if he has yet to find it. It is this message we would like to hold on to. The hope that there's a better way. The hope that there's hope.

snippet.title: One Of The Most Famous Poems In History - "Stopping By Woods On A Snowy Evening" by Robert Frost
snippet.description:
One of the most regarded and analyzed poems in history is "Stopping By Woods On A Snowy Evening" by the great 20th century poet, Robert Frost. Many explanations and analyses have been given to this poem. Some believe it might be a metaphor about the longing for death. Others believe that it is about the desire for separation from civilization and domestication. And some think that it's merely about a moment of admiration for nature. There are many theories and ways of interpreting this poem, but how do you see it?

snippet.title: Why You Shouldn't Trust What Anyone Tells You
snippet.description: It's important not to assume that the way things are or have been are the way things need to be. The way our family, friends, or society as a whole lives life on earth is not the only way. We must not limit ourselves. We must not blindly conform if the price to pay is our happiness and sense of self. We must instead look inward and decide what route we personally want to follow in life...and if it doesn't exist, we must attempt to create our own.

snippet.title: A Lost Humanity - Carl Sagan On Our Role In The Universe
snippet.description:
A profound excerpt from an interview with Carl Sagan where he discusses humanity's ignorance to the universe. He states how we must continue to open our minds and consider new ideas,  moving through outdated ones of the past.  

At first, realizing that we are so ignorant and insignificant to the universe might feel dismal, but it can actually be quite liberating. When we recognize this, life becomes a little more light-hearted and the things that don't matter, matter a little less. The need for love, compassion, happiness, and fun matter a little more. And the thrilling pursuit for knowledge and understanding continues to keep us moving forward.

snippet.title: What The World Will Be Like In 100 Years (If Everything Goes Right)
snippet.description: Disclaimer: The point of this video is not to accurately predict the future, but to illustrate potential ideals for the future. If it can be imagined, who's to say it cannot be obtained at some point? At the current rate, a lot can happen in the next 100 years, so why not imagine and hope for the best? Why not hope for humanity?

snippet.title: How To Stop Overthinking Everything – 6 Ways To Quiet The Mind
snippet.description: Overthinking is certainly a double edged sword. On one side, it can be very unpleasant and debilitating. But on the other, it can be useful to push our questions, concerns, and thoughts to the extreme in pursuit of improvement and understanding. To find the balance, we must allow overthinking to exist in our life, but remain in control of the thinking process so we can inhibit any negative side effects. In this video, we explain 6 simple ways to more easily find this sweet spot.

snippet.title: This Video Will Make You Cry – Emotional Visualization Experience
snippet.description:
In this negative visualization exercise, we guide you through a detailed experience of tragedy. A tragedy that people have and continue to endure. This could happen to you, me, or anyone. Tragedy strikes with no warning, and discriminates against no one. And sometimes we have to take a glimpse into the negativity of what could happen in life in order to remember to appreciate the positivity of what we have.

DISCLAIMER: We do not wish to offend anyone or illicit painful memories of real incidents of tragedy. Our goal is only to use the possibility of this fictitious hypothetical and the deeply unfortunate results to help create a sense of appreciation for life.

When we are in this frame of mind, remembering to appreciate the beauty and wonder of life can be exceptionally difficult. In this guided affirmation video, we will attempt to help you remember and embrace how much there is to be truly grateful and motivated for in life, so you can start your day with positivity and wonder.

snippet.title: Why Humans Struggle With Happiness
snippet.description:
How to be happy? Why is it that we all seem to have such a hard time with this? Perhaps the answer is in the question.

Song: Eureka by Huma Huma
